subject: history
title: Political Associations Before Indian National Congress
description: Early nationalist organizations and their role in awakening political consciousness

details.significance: Historic - first organized political association; though limited to landlord class
details.limitation: Represented only landed aristocracy, not common people

events.title: British Indian Association
events.description: Merged landholders' and educated middle class interests

details.formation: Merged Zamindari Association and Bengal British India Society
details.leaders: Radhakant Deb, Debendranath Tagore, Ram Gopal Ghosh
objectives: Represent to British Parliament and Government
activities: Demanded Indian representation in legislative councils
details.significance: First association to combine landlords and educated middle class; made submissions to Parliament

events.title: Poona Sarvajanik Sabha
events.description: First organization claiming to represent common people

details.founders: Mahadev Govind Ranade, Ganesh Vasudeo Joshi (Sarvajanik Kaka), S.H. Chiplunkar
details.uniqueness: First to claim to represent ALL classes including peasants
objectives: Represent interests of common people, especially peasants
activities: Demanded ryot representation in legislative councils
details.significance: Pioneer in claiming to represent peasants and common people; model for later associations

events.title: The Indian Association (Indian National Association)
events.description: Most important pre-Congress organization; precursor to INC

details.context: Founded in reaction to age restrictions for ICS examination
objectives: Create strong public opinion on political questions
Unify Indian people on common political programme
Promote friendly relations among all classes
Lower age limit for ICS examination
activities: Organized National Conference (1883) - first all-India gathering
achievements: First organization with truly national outlook
details.significance: Most important pre-Congress body; pioneered all-India political movement; Surendranath called 'Indian Burke'
details.examImportant: This was the MOST IMPORTANT pre-INC organization; laid foundation for INC

details.founders: P. Rangaiah Naidu, G. Subramania Iyer, M. Viraraghavachari, P. Ananda Charlu
objectives: Demand greater Indian representation in government
details.significance: Leading voice of South India; many founding members became INC leaders

details.founders: Pherozeshah Mehta, K.T. Telang, Badruddin Tyabji
details.significance: Leaders became prominent in INC; Pherozeshah Mehta was key figure
details.note: Formed same year as INC; leaders actively participated in Congress

summary.title: Common Features & Limitations
commonObjectives: Voice Indian grievances to British authorities
limitations: Mostly regional in scope (except Indian Association)
Limited to educated middle class and elite
No mass base or popular support
Did not demand independence or self-rule
summary.significance: These associations created foundation for organized nationalist movement; trained leaders; developed methods of political agitation; awakened political consciousness
summary.transition: Indian National Congress (1885) unified these regional efforts into national movement
summary.examTip: Remember chronology and MOST IMPORTANT: Indian Association (1876) by Surendranath Banerjee - precursor to INC, held National Conference 1883
